Dataset Description: CoNLL17 is a multilingual dependency parsing corpus covering 45 languages, providing end-to-end data from raw text to labeled dependency trees.

A dataset of cross-linguistic vocabulary assessment tasks used to measure children’s understanding and expression of nouns and verbs in multiple languages, encompassing task design, picture cues, and children’s verbal or selective response data.

Dataset Name: data deposited at the National Library of Sweden

Dataset Description: The Gold Standard dataset, derived from the Swedish semantic dictionary SALDO, contains approximately 1,998 meticulously annotated Swedish word senses using both manual and semi-automatic methods. Researchers labeled each word sense with its sentiment polarity, including positive, negative, and neutral categories. The annotation method combines direct annotation with Best-Worst Scaling (BWS) techniques to ensure the reliability, discriminative power, and consistency of the annotations. This dataset serves as the foundational training and validation resource for building the Swedish sentiment dictionary SenSALDO and is considered a high-quality benchmark annotation set in Swedish sentiment computing research.

The EUbookshop Corpus is a large-scale, multilingual, parallel text corpus collected from the EU Bookshop portal, covering 48 European languages ​​and consisting of official EU documents, books, and promotional materials. The corpus undergoes automatic alignment and cleaning, resulting in a cross-lingual parallel corpus of hundreds of millions of words, suitable for machine translation, cross-lingual analysis, and multilingual NLP research. This corpus includes paragraph and sentence-level aligned versions of the text and is one of the largest and most widely used multilingual parallel corpora in the OPUS project.
Notes: The dataset address provided in the cited paper is invalid; a new address found through a web search is valid. This dataset is multilingual.

Dataset Description: FASS is the official Swedish pharmaceutical catalog database, containing detailed information on medicines available in the Swedish market, including drug name, active ingredient, packaging specifications, indications, instructions for use, and precautions. Maintained by the Swedish Pharmaceutical Industry Association (LIF), the database is available through the FASS website or API and can be used for drug information retrieval, medical NLP research, and drug knowledge graph construction.
Notes: 1. Although the complete dataset is not publicly available for download, structured information can be obtained via API or website queries. Links to API usage instructions are provided in the URL obtained via search engines section.                                2. FASS data does not include specific cited papers.

Dataset Description: HFST-SweNER is a Swedish Named Entity Recognition (NER) dataset, annotated from a Swedish corpus, covering entity categories such as personal names, place names, and organizations. The data primarily comes from newspapers, news releases, and online text, and has undergone manual correction and standardized annotation. This dataset aims to support natural language processing tasks in Swedish, particularly in entity recognition, information extraction, and language modeling research.

Swedish Kelly-list is a core Swedish vocabulary list, originally used for language teaching and vocabulary difficulty annotation. The dataset contains high-frequency words along with their parts of speech, semantic categories, and difficulty levels. It has been expert-reviewed and standardized, aiming to support Swedish language teaching, vocabulary learning, reading comprehension research, and vocabulary selection and complexity analysis in natural language processing.

Korp, provided by Språkbanken in Sweden, is a multi-corpus access and analysis platform that integrates various types of Swedish texts, including news, newspapers, literary works, spoken language corpora, and social media. Users can search, analyze, annotate, and perform corpora on Korp, supporting a variety of linguistic research and natural language processing tasks.
Notes: 1. The citing paper requires paid access.                         2.  Korp is a platform tool and cannot be used solely as a dataset.

Dataset Description: The NSTs leksikalske database for svensk is a Swedish lexicon database established by the Swedish National Institute for Language Technologies (NST). It contains lexical inflections, parts of speech, phonetic transcriptions, and some semantic information for Swedish words, and provides lexical analysis and generation rules. This database is used for natural language processing, morphological research, and linguistic experiments, and provides fundamental resources for Swedish spell checking, lexical analysis, and vocabulary statistics.

Lexin is a Swedish vocabulary database, originally developed for building bilingual dictionaries for teaching immigrant languages. The dataset contains Swedish entries and their corresponding immigrant language translations, parts of speech, phonetic transcriptions, and some semantic information. Lexin supports language learning, lexical analysis, dictionary development, and natural language processing research, and is a structured, programmable Swedish vocabulary resource.
Notes: Lexin is a database, not a dataset.

Dataset Description: The Swedish Talbanken Treebank is a syntactic treebank built upon the Swedish written corpus of Talbanken (Einarsson, 1976), initially covering the Prose portion. The dataset performs part-of-speech tagging and syntactic analysis on each sentence, using phrase structures or dependency relations to represent grammatical structures. This treebank is widely used in Swedish natural language processing, syntactic analysis, part-of-speech tagging, and linguistic research, and also supports conversion to Universal Dependencies format.
Tasks: POS Tagging, Syntactic analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Notes: The cited paper does not have a specific link.

Dataset Description: an open-domain question answering evaluation set comprising 10k question-answer pairs aligned across 26 typologically diverse languages (260k question-answer pairs in total). The goal of this dataset is to provide a challenging benchmark for question answering quality across a wide set of languages
Tasks: Multilingual Comprehension & Generalization, Cross-Lingual QA Evaluation
Notes: This dataset is multilingual.

Dataset Name (Validated): Nordic Dialect Corpus and Syntax Database
Dataset Description: The Nordic Dialect Corpus and Syntax Database is a corpus covering Scandinavian dialects, containing both written and spoken texts with micro-syntactic annotations. The dataset collects sentence, paragraph, and syntactic structure information from various Nordic dialects, serving as an important resource for studying micro-syntactic variation, dialectal differences, and validating linguistic theories. It is also a valuable resource for Nordic linguistics and NLP research.
Tasks: Natural Language Processing (NLP), Dialect Variation Analysis, Linguistic Studies, Syntactic analysis
Notes: This dataset is multilingual.

Dataset Description: The Nordic Word Order Database (NWD) is a database that records the word order and syntactic structure of North Germanic dialects, covering languages ​​such as Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Icelandic, and Faroese. The dataset contains sentences collected through experiments and fieldwork, with syntactic annotations, used to study regional variations in grammatical phenomena such as subject, verb, and object positions.
Tasks: Dialect Variation Analysis, Syntactic analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Linguistic Studies
Notes: 1. Accessing the URL "Provided by cited paper" requires an account login.       2. his dataset is multilingual

Dataset Description: The Pseudo-parallel Swedish simplification dataset is a corpus built for the task of Swedish text simplification. Due to the lack of a large-scale, formal corpus of simplified texts, the authors generated pseudo-parallel sentence pairs through an automatic alignment strategy with the original text and a readability scoring strategy: each original sentence is paired with a corresponding simplified version, thus forming a dataset that can be used to train and evaluate text simplification models. This dataset covers news and general text, supporting research on automatic Swedish text simplification.
Notes: You may need to contact the author to obtain the data.
Paid access to cited paper
same to 9733

Dataset Description: SALDO’s Morphology is a large-scale Swedish morphological dictionary built by Språkbanken for the SALDO lexical semantic network. It contains information such as word forms, inflectional changes, word classes, derivation relations, and the mapping from word forms to lexical units. It provides a complete morphological structure of the Swedish vocabulary and is suitable for morphological analysis, word form deconstruction, language modeling, corpus processing, and building NLP toolchains. It is one of the core foundational resources in Swedish language technology.
Tasks: Morphological Analysis, Part-of-speech tagging, Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Notes: SALDO’s Morpholog is a dictionary, not a dataset.

Dataset Description: ScaLA (Scandinavian Linguistic Acceptability) is a dataset for judging the acceptability of languages ​​in Swedish, Norwegian, and Danish, containing a large number of artificially constructed and real sentences with "acceptable/unacceptable" labels. This dataset aims to evaluate a model's understanding of syntactic phenomena in Scandinavian languages, including core grammatical structures such as word order, subject-verb agreement, and pronoun placement. It is one of the largest syntactic acceptability testing resources for Scandinavian languages.
Notes: 1.The phrase "URL Provided by cited paper" is no longer valid; "URL obtained via search engines" is acceptable.                          2.This dataset is multilingual.

Dataset Description: SMULTRON is a multilingual parallel syntactic tree library containing parallel sentences in Swedish, English, and German, and providing syntactic structure annotations (constituent trees and dependency trees) for each sentence.
Notes: 1.The phrase "URL Provided by cited paper" is no longer valid; "URL obtained via search engines" is acceptable.                          2.This dataset is multilingual.

Språkbanken Text is a text corpus platform maintained by Språkbanken (Language Bank of the University of Gothenburg) in Sweden; it is not a dataset.

Dataset Description: DaLAJ v1.0 is a Swedish learner sentence acceptability dataset containing written sentences from Swedish second language learners. Each sentence includes the original sentence (incorrect sentence) and the corrected version, along with information such as error type, learner's native language level, and course level.
Tasks: Second Language Acquisition Analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Dataset Description: DaLAJ is a Swedish language acceptability and learner language research dataset, derived from authentic essays written by Swedish second language learners. The dataset contains pairs of "incorrect sentences" and "corrected sentences," along with metadata such as error type and learner background.
Tasks: Second Language Acquisition Analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Dataset Description: The Swedish Culturomics Gigaword Corpus is a Swedish corpus exceeding one billion words, covering diverse text sources (novels, government documents, news, scientific articles, and social media, etc.) from 1950 to 2015. It provides NLP research with a representative Swedish corpus of mixed texts, annotated by date and domain. Its design goal is to improve the comparability and reproducibility of language processing experiments.

DaLAJ v1.0 is a Swedish learner sentence acceptability dataset containing written sentences from Swedish second language learners. Each sentence includes the original sentence (incorrect sentence) and the corrected version, along with information such as error type, learner's native language level, and course level.
Tasks: Second Language Acquisition Analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Dataset Description: SuperLim is a multi-task benchmark dataset for Swedish Natural Language Understanding (NLU), and is an implementation of SwedishGLUE. It combines multiple sub-tasks, including grammatical acceptability judgment (DaLAJ), natural language inference (NLI), sentiment analysis, and text similarity, for evaluating and fine-tuning Swedish language models.
Tasks: Sentiment Analysis, Text Classification, Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Dataset Description: Swedish MuClaGED is a dataset for detecting grammatical errors in Swedish language learners' writing, expanded from the SweLL-gold learner essay corpus. The dataset annotates each token, indicating the presence and type of grammatical error.
Tasks: Learner Writing Assessment, Grammatical Error Detection (GED)

Dataset Description: MultiGED is a dataset for detecting multi-category grammatical errors in Swedish learners' writing, extended from the SweLL-gold learner essay corpus. The dataset annotates each token, indicating the presence and type of grammatical error, covering various error types (spelling, grammatical structure, lexical selection, etc.).
Tasks: Grammatical Error Detection (GED), Learner Writing Assessment

SweFraCaS is a Swedish version of the classic FraCaS entailment dataset, containing 305 sentence pairs designed to test natural language inference (NLI) and textual entailment.

Dataset Description: Swesaurus is a free Swedish “wordnet”-style lexical resource: a lexicon built by combining and re-using lexical-semantic relations from several existing Swedish resources (e.g. SALDO, Synlex, semantic databases, Swedish Wiktionary, and mappings to a core WordNet).

SweWAC is a large-scale Swedish web corpus, compiled from crawled web pages to reflect contemporary written Swedish. It contains approximately 114 million tokens and includes diverse text types such as news articles, blogs, forums, and other online sources.

Swesaurus is a free Swedish “wordnet”-style lexical resource: a lexicon built by combining and re-using lexical-semantic relations from several existing Swedish resources (e.g. SALDO, Synlex, semantic databases, Swedish Wiktionary, and mappings to a core WordNet).
Notes: According to the official description of Swesaurus, the resource was later integrated into another larger Swedish lexical semantic resource, Swesaurus.

Dataset Description: Talbanken05 is a Swedish treebank containing syntactically annotated sentences from various sources, including newspaper text, interviews, and student essays. It provides both phrase-structure and dependency annotations, making it a key resource for computational Swedish syntax research.
Tasks: Syntactic analysis, Part-of-speech tagging, Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Dataset Description: UD_Swedish‑Talbanken is a Swedish dependency treebank in Universal Dependencies (UD) format, derived from the Talbanken05 corpus.
Tasks: Part-of-speech tagging, Syntactic analysis, Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Notes: UD_Swedish-Talbanken is a derivative version of Talbanken05 within the UD framework.

Dataset Description: WSJ‑CSR (Wall Street Journal Continuous Speech Recognition Corpus) is a large-scale American English speech and text corpus derived from WSJ news articles.
Tasks: Automatic speech recognition, Natural Language Processing (NLP)
